item.description:
Let's try something new! We will be entering in a Spartan Sprint obstacle course race of 4 hilly miles and at least 10 obstacles. This race is on both June 2nd and June 3rd but our team is scheduled for Sunday, June 3rd at 10:30 AM if you choose to join our team.

General Description:

Spartan Sprints are muddy 3+- mile events with 10 or more obstacles. The challenging sprint races are a great way to get off your couch and start living. Beginners to hardcore warriors, and marathon runners alike come out to test themselves on the insane obstacles! This 5k race is comprised of mud runs, obstacles, trail racing, physical challenges and mental challenges all in a 3mi race. 99.9% of all people who try this event will finish, and 100% will have their thirst for mud fully satisfied! Top 3 Males and top 3 Females at each Spartan Sprint qualify for a free entry into a Super Spartan of his or her choice.


What you get?

      • Spartan Race T-Shirt
      • Spartan Race Finisher Medal
      • One free beer (must be 21 or older) for USA events only
      • Food Vendors
      • Music/MC
      • Awards Ceremony
      • Top finishers receive free entry into a Super Spartan of their choice
      • Completion earns you Spartan Agility certification (Black Level)

Fee for entry:
(Note, if you join with our team a portion of your fee will be refunded depending on how many people join our team.)

Individual:

entry fee - Until
$60 December 2nd (Early Bird)
$70 January 2nd
$78 February 2nd
$83 March 2nd
$87 April 2nd
$90 May 2nd
$95 May 16th
$100 May 30th (Registration Closes)

Team Discounts:

        • Teams of 4-15 members each receive a $5 rebate a few days before the event.
        • Teams of 16-29 members each receive a $10 rebate a few days before the event.
        • Teams of 30+ members each receive a $15 rebate a few days before the event.

You can join an existing team through two options:

Option 1: You use the unique registration link by your team captain (Kevin Skee) that brings you to the specific team registration page. (https://cui.active.com/event-reg/select-race?e=1744802&pse=1745002&tid=1622303&tname=Hartford%20Area%20Hiking )

Option 2: You know your team name (Hartford Area Hiking) and password (we have no password set). On the registration page click "Join an Existing Team" and search for your team. There you will be prompted for the password and can register with your team.

$12 Casualty Insurance purchase is mandatory during registration.

Armed forces and students receive a $10 discount at registration. **participants will be required to show valid military or student identification at check-in or must pay the full registration fee.

Competitive heats will be an additional $10

Registrations are final.  No refunds. No changing start waves.

Spectators:

Spectator tickets are $15 and sold onsite (please bring cash, limited Credit Card services are available). As a Spartan Race spectator, you get $5 Spartan bucks redeemable at the merchandise tent, a festival map, and rad access to some obstacles on the course, the epic Gladiator pit and finish line, the vendor tents, and hot food for sale on the grounds!

Parking:

Parking is $10 per vehicle (cash only).

Start Times:

Heats start at 7am with up to 250 racers per heat and continuing every 30 minutes throughout the day. Enter the 9am “Elite” heat if you want to be as competitive as possible and race against the best. (Our team is scheduled for 10:30 AM Sunday, June 3rd)

It is strongly recommended to arrive 2 hour before the first race (i.e. 5am) to avoid registration and traffic/parking issues.

 

Distance:

3.5 hilly miles, fastest time should be around 40 minutes. Longest times will be close to 2 hours. This is a chip-timed event.

Obstacles:

There are some staples in their repertoire. There are also some venue specific and terrain inspired obstacles. They will not, however, spell it out for you. As well, you will get no course map to inspect. There is fire, mud, water, barbed wire, and occasionally Hell on Earth. There WILL be obstacles to catch you off guard. Curve balls, so to speak. Get over it. They’re here to rip you from your comfort zone.

If you need a road map for each step of the way, then maybe this race isn’t for you.

Spartans don’t skip obstacles, we overcome them! We strongly discourage skipping obstacles without attempting them as it is unfair to others that do attempt them. However, if you must skip an obstacle that you DO first at least try but simply cannot complete it, there will be a mandatory set of burpees (http://youtu.be/1xVN8Hh7mDU) that you must complete before moving on. This is the case with ALL obstacles. so that can be a lot of burpees - so try hard and complete those obstacles.

 

Tri-State NY Spartan Sprint -June 2/3, 2012 (REGISTER HERE, for race we are going to).

Our team is scheduled for June 3rd, 10:30 AM so try to get that time. If you get a heat later in the day, that is OK but you just won't be running with the others on the team. June 2nd is 80% full as of 1/21/12. Let's all try to get in on the 3rd for 10:30 AM!

Team Registration: (Team is: Hartford Area Hiking)
https://cui.active.com/event-reg/select-race?e=1744802&pse=1745002&tid=1622303&tname=Hartford%20Area%20Hiking

Individual Registration (or for Option 2 team entry):
http://www.spartanrace.com/tristate-obstacle-racing-spartan-sprint-2012.html

Approximate location/directions (Tuxedo Ridge Ski Center, 581 Route 17A West, Tuxedo, NY):
http://mapq.st/yjbChB

 

Classes of Spartan Races:

Spartan Sprint - 3+ miles, 10+ obstacles - Description:
http://www.spartanrace.com/spartan-sprint-obstacle-course-race.html

Super Spartan - 8-10 miles, 15+ obstacles - Description:
http://www.spartanrace.com/super-spartan-obstacle-course-race.html

Spartan Beast - 10-12 miles, 18+ obstacles - Description:
http://www.spartanrace.com/spartan-beast-obstacle-course-race.html

Spartan Death Race - over 48+ hours, 90% will not finish - Description:
http://www.spartanrace.com/spartan-death-race-vermont.html

Videos of various Spartan Races:
http://spartanrace.tv/?v=malibu

 

Tuxedo Ridge Ski Center -Where the event is being held (581 Route 17A West, Tuxedo, NY 10987 ~ Phone (845)351-1122)
http://tuxedoridge.com/

Spartan Sprint photos there from 6/5/11:
http://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.10150622855805076.686598.214766850075&type=3

Spartan Race Obstacle Course Races -Main website
http://www.spartanrace.com/index.html

 

=== Legal Stuff ===

By clicking on "Yes" for this event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows: In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Hartford Area Hiking meetup group for and related to the above listed event. I attest and verify that I am physically fit to participate in any portion of this above listed event. I grant Hartford Area Hiking permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of this event for any purpose.
item.how_to_find_us: Silver Ford Escape SUV, CT plates. Kevin S will have bib# 21548.

group.name: The Hartford Area Hiking™ Meetup Group

item.name: Spartan Sprint Obstacle Course Race in Tuxedo NY
